a.xlink:title: Raimond is a good Raytracer. Logic, it's Raimond.
Launch the raytracing process.
Retrieve the error message.
Builds a BVH from a list of smart pointers to primitives.
Validates the command-line argument count.
Creates a camera from render parameters.
Applies a basic denoising algorithm to the framebuffer.
Extracts render parameters from command-line arguments.
Check if debug mode is enabled through CLI args.
Loads a scene from file, or exits on failure.
Determines whether to display a progress bar.
Parses thread count from CLI arguments.
Execute the full post-processing pipeline on a frame-buffer.
Performs the raytracing process and produces the framebuffer.
Writes the framebuffer to a .ppm image file.
Extracts raw pointers to primitives from shared_ptr objects.
Recursively loads a scene and any referenced sub-scenes from file(s).
Loads a single scene file (non-recursive).
Initialise the global skybox texture.
Apply a simple filmic tone-mapping curve.
Radial vignette fall-off factor for pixel *(i,j)*.
Execute a parallel for loop from start to end - 1.
Prints a terminal progress bar for rendering.
Generate a primary ray through screen coordinates *(s,t)*.
Recursive path-tracing integrator.
Compute the incoming light direction at a surface point.
Computes the dot product between this and another vector.
Intersect a ray with all objects in the scene.
Get the scalar intensity (power) of the light.
Returns a normalized (unit-length) copy of the vector.
Retrieve the light’s world-space position if applicable.
Generate a single uniform random number in [0,1).
Cosine-weighted hemisphere sampling around a shading normal.
Procedural horizon-to-zenith gradient.
Get the type of this light.
